title: Maltese lira
summary: The lira  (Maltese: lira Maltija, plural: liri, ISO 4217 code : MTL) or pound (until 1986 in English) was the currency of Malta from 1972 until 31 December 2007. After 1986 the lira was abbreviated as Lm, although the original ₤M sign was often used locally. In English the currency was still frequently called the pound even after its official English language name was changed to lira.
